  • Field Details

    • randomMap

      private final Map<RNGHandler.RNGTypes,​Random> randomMap

      private long startTime

  • Constructor Details

    • RNGHandler

      protected RNGHandler​(long seed)
      Initializes a new RNGHandler using the provided Long. Great care is advised when using this constructor.

      If the same Random flow as provided in RNGSession(long) isn't followed, the random number generation might not be backwards reproducible by verifiers.

      Parameters:
      seed - the Long used as a seed for the randomMap

  • Method Details

    • createRNGHandlerOrNull

      public static RNGHandler createRNGHandlerOrNull​(long runId)
      Creates a new RNGHandler using the provided runId and the GetRandom token obtained from the Verification-Server. This method should be called asynchronous due to the delay associated with the request.
      Parameters:
      runId - the Long runId of the session the newly created RNGHandler should belong to.
      Returns:
      a new RNGHandler or null if an IOException occurred when making the request
      See Also:
      RNGHandler(long), ServerSideRNG.getGetRandomToken(long)

    • getRngValue

      public long getRngValue​(RNGHandler.RNGTypes type)
      Returns the next random Long for the specified type of RNGHandler.RNGTypes
      Parameters:
      type - the RNGHandler.RNGTypes to return the random for
      Returns:
      a long generated and logged by the Verification-Server

    • activate

      public void activate()
      Activates the RNGHandler by setting the startTime to the current System Time

    • outOfNormalTime

      public boolean outOfNormalTime()
      Returns whether the RNGHandler has passed its standard ServerSideRNGConfig.USE_TIME
      Returns:
      true if the current System.nanoTime() minus the startTime is bigger than the ServerSideRNGConfig.USE_TIME

    • outOfExtraTime

      public boolean outOfExtraTime()
      Returns whether the RNGHandler has passed its ServerSideRNGConfig.EXTRA_TIME
      Returns:
      true if the current System.nanoTime() minus the startTime is bigger than the ServerSideRNGConfig.USE_TIME + the ServerSideRNGConfig.EXTRA_TIME
